abort_conditions_met.description: Git identity configuration and history contain personal information that would leak with OSS release

critical_issues: Git identity configuration contains personal information: 'Jeremy Green <hello@jeremy.green>'
Git history contamination with personal identity across multiple commit entries
Git logs expose personal information to anyone who clones the repository
immediate_actions_required: Fix git identity configuration before continuing OSS assessment
Choose git history remediation strategy (rewrite or fresh repository)
Only proceed with remaining agents after identity sanitization passes
next_steps: PRIORITY 1: Execute git identity fixes immediately
PRIORITY 2: Verify clean git configuration and history
PRIORITY 4: Continue with remaining OSS pipeline agents only after PASS

risk_assessment.immediate_threat: Personal information exposure with any public release

code_quality_context.note: Code quality appears exceptional based on initial analysis
code_quality_context.caveat: Cannot proceed with full assessment until PII issues resolved
code_quality_context.technical_readiness: Appears high, pending completion of security pipeline
